title: Border, 1820–50
description: a) main pattern of this border consists of a band of alternating vertical leaves and arrow heads connected at the base by a system of curls. Three stripes run along the upper edge, while the lower edge is banded by a string of pointed ellipses connected by round beads. Each "ellipse"is outlined in dots and contains a sprig that points in the opposite direction of its neighbor. Printed in greens, gray, white, mustard and mauve on a black background; b) a narrow band superimposed over "13-a". Border consists of a cable pattern with two different, alternating segments: one with serrated highlights, and the other with rows of dots and stripes. Printed in greens, white and gray on black; c) A later superimposition of "19-a". This border consists of a continuous horizontal branch wrapped around in foliage, more naturalistic than the underlying border. Printed in rust, browns, yellow, ochre, light and dark green and black; d) Companion to "13-a". Consists of a temple set into a landscape, flanked by a palm-like tree and a pine, alternating with a long-tailed bird around which rose branches have been arranged.

tombstone.epitaph:
Border, 1820–50.
1820–50. Block-printed on handmade paper. Gift of Josephine Howell. 1972-42-13-a/o.
